Question
========
When describing the motion of an object, displacement is

Answerlist
----------
* the direction in which the object moves.
* the scalar of the object's velocity.
* how far and in which direction the object ends up relative to its starting position.
* the amount of ground covered by the moving object.

Solution
========
Displacement is a vector that describes how far and in which direction an object
ends up relative to its starting position. It is not always the same as the distance because distance is a scalar.
